articles.title: Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Physical Exercise Center in Thongil Street
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Physical Exercise Center in Thongil Street
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, together with his wife Ri Sol Ju, gave field guidance to the Physical Exercise Center in Thongil Street nearing its completion.
					The Physical Exercise Center in Thongil Street is a modern one built according to the direct initiative and plan of Kim Jong Un who is always deeply concerned for the promotion of people's health and living standard.
					
					The center having a total floor space of13 749 square metres  consists of a physical exercise room for health, underwater supersonic wave room, recovery room, table-tennis room, soft drink shop, etc. 
					
					It is well equipped with 138 sporting apparatuses of 61 kinds including apparatuses for running, cycling and paddling exercises and modern medical facilities.
					
					Going round various places of the center, Kim Jong Un acquainted himself in detail with the apparatuses and their distribution and use project.
					
					Making the rounds of the physical exercise rooms for health on the ground and first floors, he learned in detail about the features of apparatuses.
					
					Seeing various kinds of physical exercise apparatuses one by one, he said it is important to rationally distribute the apparatuses as befitting the center for the people.
					
					At the rooms, he said that in order to help working people to train their physical bodies by use of various sporting apparatuses, and receive medical treatment it is necessary to cooperate with experts to seek and positively apply scientific methods of using apparatuses suited to their age and physical characteristics.
					
					At the recovery room he said when servants acquire expertise knowledge including physical treatment method, they can positively contribute to the promotion of people's health and medical treatment.
					
					At the physical exercise room for health on the second floor, he noted that it was arranged better than the rooms on the ground and first floors.
					
					Apparatuses for running and cycling exercises are good, he said, noting that if not only school youth and children but office workers who work in rooms all day long take exercises and receive medical treatment at the center, they can devote themselves to the revolutionary work in good health.
					
					Going round the underwater supersonic wave room furnished with modern supersonic wave equipment to stimulate each region of body and equipment for wet and dry steam bath and shower, he underlined to need provide service well so that working people may find the center effective for physical exercises and medical treatment.
					
					It is the steadfast determination and will of the Workers' Party of Korea to enable the best people in the world to fully enjoy wealth and prosperity under socialism, he said, calling for operating the center well so that the happy laughter of the people may be heard from the center.
					
					He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Kyong Ok, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Goes Round Pyongyang Folk Park
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Goes Round Pyongyang Folk Park
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, together with his wife Ri Sol Ju, went round the Pyongyang Folk Park nearing its completion.
					The peculiar folk park covers a vast area around the site of the Anhak Palace on Mt. Taesong.
					
					The park consists of the district for comprehensive education of history, district for the display of historic relics, modern district, folk village district, folk playing district, park district of Mt. Paektu and Mt. Kumgang and the management and operation district. It is an open-air history museum where visitors can see and experience at first hand the Korean history and folk custom.
					
					After hearing a report from commanding officers that the park has been successfully completed, Kim Jong Un went round its various places.
					
					At the education district at the entrance of the park, he went round visual boards for comprehensive education of history set up in the form of a large mural painting.
					
					The Korean people have acquired an advantageous national identity, taking the road of independent development for a long historic period, he said, adding only when the younger generation know about this well, can they deeply grasp the Korean nation-first spirit.
					
					At the district for the display of historic relics he saw round picture boards and primitive straw-thatched huts showing the lifestyle of primitive people, Mausoleum of King Tangun, dolmens and pipha-shape daggers during ancient Korea, Mausoleum of King Tongmyong, monument to the Mausoleum of King Kwanggaetho and Kumggang Temple Pagoda during Koguryo period, Miruk Temple Pagoda of Paekje, Hwangryong Temple Pagoda of Silla and a stone lantern    during Palhae period.
					
					Viewing structures of reduced sizes at the modern district such as Kim Il Sung Square, Grand People's Study House, Korean Revolution Museum, Mansudae Art Theatre and West Sea Barrage not only from distance but at close range, he was satisfied to learn that the soldier-builders set right the defects mentioned by him when visiting there in January.
					
					Seeing the structure depicting leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan secret camp, he underlined the need to plant trees appropriate for the building so that its environment may look like its original one and successfully conduct afforestation so that there may be a clear distinction among different lots.
					
					Standing before a miniature of the Korean Revolution Museum, he said when people come there they would think of the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill, calling for successfully erecting their statues and group sculptures of subsidiary theme. 
					
					It is necessary to set up a miniature of Panmunjom symbolic of division so that people may harden their resolution to reunify the country in our generation without fail, he noted.
					
					He gave an instruction to construct in the park miniatures of the Three-Revolution Museum and the People's Theatre and other buildings newly built or those omitted as the area of the park is so vast.
					
					Going round the folk village district, he was pleased to learn that typical structures belonging to the primitive age, period of ancient Korea, ancient period and periods of Koguryo and Koryo retain their former glory.
					
					At the miniature of the government office of Koguryo, he said the building was constructed well on the principle of historicism, adding if models of soldiers of government army wearing uniforms of the Koguryo period are set up at the entrance to the government office, visitors will think of aspects of society in that period.
					
					He also went round the Korean Folk Museum newly built inside the park.
					
					After going round the Palhae Palace, he saw historic relics unearthed by soldier-builders of KPA Large Combined Unit 630 in the course of construction and pencil drawings done by them.
					
					He said that going round the park nearing its completion, he missed Kim Jong Il very much. He said with deep emotion how happy he would have been, if he had accompanied Kim Jong Il who personally initiated its construction.
					
					He called for managing and operating the park well to help people and school youth and children more deeply grasp the Juche character and national identity. 
					
					He underlined the need to build the world district, too, at the park so that they may have profound knowledge about history and tradition of other countries while seeing buildings of various countries of the world.
					
					He enjoyed large reed ensemble "Song of devotedly defending the leader, looking up to the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun" presented by soldier-builders of KPA Large Combined Unit 630.
					
					He gave the highest appreciation to the large combined unit, saying it has performed shining labor feats on the forefront of socialist construction by powerfully demonstrating the revolutionary soldier spirit and the fighting spirit of devotedly implementing the leader's instructions in the construction of the park. He, at the same time, extended thanks of the KPA Supreme Commander to the unit. 
					
					He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Choe Thae Bok, Pak To Chun, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Kim Kyong Ok, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Kim Pyong Ho and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Moon Sun Myung
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Moon Sun Myung
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un Friday sent a wreath to the bier of Moon Sun Myung, president of the World Peace Federation, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Wreath Sent by Kim Jong Un to Moon Sun Myung Conveyed to His Bereaved Family
articles.content:
Wreath Sent by Kim Jong Un to Moon Sun Myung Conveyed to His Bereaved Family
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A wreath sent by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un to the bier of Moon Sun Myung was conveyed to his bereaved family on Friday.
					It was conveyed to Moon Hyung Jin who is a member of the bereaved family of Moon Sun Myung, by Jang Song Thaek, vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, and Kim Yang Gon, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					Jang Song Thaek courteously conveyed to him the deep condolences expressed by Marshal Kim Jong Un over the passing of Moon. 
					
					Moon Hyung Jin was deeply moved by the fact that Kim Jong Un sent a message of condolences, a wreath and words of consolation over the passing of Moon Sun Myung. He extended his warmest thanks to Kim Jong Un.
					
					Present on the occasion was a person concerned of the funeral committee from south side.
					
					A ceremony for awarding the National Reunification Prize to Moon Sun Myung was held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall that day.
					
					Present there were Thae Hyong Chol, secretary general of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, officials concerned, members of the bereaved families of the deceased and persons concerned.
					
					After a decree of the Presidium of the SPA of the DPRK was read out, the prize awarding to Moon Sun Myung who positively contributed to the patriotic cause for the peaceful reunification of the country and the prosperity common to the nation was conveyed to Moon Hyung Jin.
					
					The member of the bereaved family of the deceased and the person concerned of the funeral committee arrived in Pyongyang Friday via Kaesong.

articles.title: Condolences over Death of Moon Sun Myung
articles.content:
Condolences over Death of Moon Sun Myung
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- State officials and officials of friendly parties, religious organizations and relevant bodies visited the World Peace Center to express condolences over the death of Moon Sun Myung, president of the World Peace Federation.
					Hanging on the wall of the mourning place was a portrait of the late Moon.
					
					Seen standing there was a wreath sent by Marshal Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					Also placed there were wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea, the Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea, the C.C., the Korean Social Democratic Party, the C.C., the Chondoist Chongu Party, the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, the National Reconciliation Council, religious organizations and relevant bodies.
					
					Among the mourners were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the C.C., the Korean Social Democratic Party, and officials of friendly parties, religious organizations and relevant organs.
					
					Present there from the south side were Moon Hyung Jin, who is a member of the bereaved family, a person concerned of the funeral committee and bereaved family members here.
					
					They observed a moment's silence in memory of Moon who made efforts for the nation's reconciliation and unity, the country's reunification and world peace.

articles.title: U.S. Forces' Presence in S. Korea Is Vivid Expression of Hostile Policy toward DPRK: Foreign Ministry Spokesman
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' Presence in S. Korea Is Vivid Expression of Hostile Policy toward DPRK: Foreign Ministry Spokesman
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Foreign Ministry spokesman released the following statement Friday with the lapse of 67 years since the U.S. forces' occupation of south Korea:
					The U.S. occupation of south Korea in the first days of Cold War between the East and the West was aimed to secure a bridgehead for realizing its strategy for the military domination of the Eurasian continent.
					
					This quenched the nation's desire for complete sovereignty of the country and its independent development and led to the territorial and national division.
					
					From the first day of its presence in south Korea, the U.S. trained pro-U.S. forces and prodded them to escalate confrontation with the fellow countrymen in its ceaseless moves to launch invasion and ignite a new war to seize whole Korean Peninsula.
					
					For more than half a century the DPRK has fallen a victim to the U.S. forces in south Korea which regarded the DPRK as the No. 1 target of attack. This compelled the DPRK to build its own nuclear deterrent even by tightening its belt to cope with the nuclear threats from the world's biggest nuclear weapons state.
					
					The U.S. forces' presence in south Korea turned the Korean Peninsula into the world's biggest hotspot and it has become a malignant tumor that seriously threatens peace and stability in Northeast Asia and, furthermore, the rest of the world.
					
					Pursuant to the new defense strategy of amassing armed forces in the Asia-Pacific region, the U.S. seeks its forces' permanent presence in south Korea while saying that their mission is to "maintain regional peace", not just to "defend" south Korea.
					
					The U.S. forces in south Korea are becoming forward-deployed forces and "strategic mobile forces" whose nature and role are to contain China and Russia and hold military hegemony in the region. Here the south Korean puppet forces are playing the role of colonial stooges tasked with the duty of executing the U.S. war policy for aggression.
					
					The U.S. is increasing the frequency and scale of military exercises of various codenames to boost the U.S. mobility and attack capabilities under the pretext of coping with "provocations" and "nuclear threats" from the DPRK, thereby pushing the situation to the brink of a war.
					
					The U.S. persistent denial of the conclusion of a peace treaty with the DPRK is aimed to keep the DPRK as its enemy, a pretext for its forces' permanent presence in south Korea.
					
					The U.S. forces' presence in south Korea is the most vivid expression of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					As long as its forces remain in south Korea, the U.S. is not entitled to claim that it has no hostile intent toward the DPRK and no one will believe it, either.
					
					The U.S. continued hostile policy toward the DPRK will only force the DPRK to bolster its nuclear deterrent, making the prospect for solving the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula gloomier.
					
					The withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea is a common task of parties concerned desirous of lasting peace and prosperity of the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					If the U.S. seeks to keep its forces in south Korea, contrary to the unanimous desire of the regional people, it had better get itself ready to taste an all-out war with the DPRK.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK and Vietnamese Delegations Held
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Vietnamese Delegations Held
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Talks were held here Friday between the delegations of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea (DFRK) and the Central Committee of the Fatherland Front of Vietnam (FFV).
					Present there from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the Central Committee of the DFRK led by Director of its Secretariat Kim Wan Su and from the Vietnamese side were members of the delegation of the Central Committee of the FFV led by President Huing Dam and Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Le Quang Ba.
					
					At the talks the two sides exchanged views on the matter of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between two organizations and issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Italian Guests
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Italian Guestsg
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Osvaldo Napoli, chairman of the Committee for the Development of Relations and Cooperation with the DPRK of the Parliament who is vice-president of the Parliamentary Group of the Popular Liberty of the Chamber of Deputies of Italy, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets with Kanji Inoki and His Party
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets with Kanji Inoki and His Party
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with Kanji Inoki, president of Inoki Genom Joint Co., Ltd. of Japan, and his party on a visit to the DPRK at Koryo Hotel on Friday.

articles.title: Brazilian Ambassador to DPRK Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Brazilian Ambassador to DPRK Hosts Reception
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Brazilian Ambassador to the DPRK Roberto Colin hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Friday on the occasion of the 190th independence day of Brazil.
					Present there on invitation were DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Hyong Jun, vice foreign minister, Jong Jin Song, vice-chairman of the Commission for Joint Venture and Investment, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairman of the DPRK-Brazil Friendship and Culture Association, and other officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					Staff members of the Brazilian embassy were present there.
					
					Roberto Colin said in his speech that it is the stand of Brazil to boost the bilateral cooperative relations with the DPRK.
					
					Noting that ceaseless confrontation policies towards the DPRK are very harmful to the peace in the region and other parts of the world, he said measures are necessary for settling them.
					
					He hoped the Korean people would register great achievements in socio-economic development under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Pak Ui Chun said the DPRK and Brazil have supported and cooperated with each other since they forged friendly ties.
					
					Visits of delegations at different levels are brisk between the two countries in the recent years and they have supported each other in the international arena, he noted, and continued:
					
					The DPRK will set store by the friendship with Brazil and make positive efforts to boost the cooperative relations with it in the future, too.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of greeting from Syrian President Bashar Al- Assad on September 5.
					The message said:
					
					I would like to extend on behalf of the Syrian people and on my own behalf most heartfelt congratulations to you and the friendly people of your country on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the foundation of the DPRK and wish you good health and your people greater progress and prosperity.
					
					Availing myself of this opportunity, I affirm that I will boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the Syrian Arab Republic and the DPRK in conformity with the wellbeing of the friendly peoples of the two countries. 
					
					Please accept my highest tribute to you.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Lebanese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Lebanese President
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of greeting from Lebanese President Michel Souleyman on Sept. 3.
					The message said:
					
					It gives me pleasure to extend on my own behalf and on behalf of the Lebanese people sincere congratulations to you on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK and wish you happiness and success and the Korean people prosperity.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from President of Inoki Genom Joint Co., Ltd. of Japan
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from President of Inoki Genom Joint Co., Ltd. of Japan
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by Kanji Inoki, president of the Inoki Genom Joint Co., Ltd. of Japan on a visit to the DPRK.
					Inoki conveyed the gift to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, on Friday.

articles.title: Floral Baskets and Congratulatory Letters to Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Floral Baskets and Congratulatory Letters to Kim Jong Un
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received floral baskets and congratulatory letters from the diplomatic corps and the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					They were handed to Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun by Cambodian Ambassador Chhorn Hay and Chinese Ambassador Liu Hongcai on behalf of the diplomatic corps and to Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Gak, minister of the People's Armed Forces, by Hassan Reza Husseini, military attache of the Iranian embassy, who is doyen of the corps on Friday.
					
					Meanwhile a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK and the Chief of the Economic Cooperation Bureau of Libya and a floral basket from Nigerian ambassador to Kim Jong Un were conveyed to officials concerned.

articles.title: Members of UNICEF Office Lay Floral Basket before Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Members of UNICEF Office Lay Floral Basket before Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Representative Desiree Jongsma and members of the Office of United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) in Pyongyang laid a floral basket before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Friday on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					They placed it before the statues in boundless reverence for the peerlessly great men and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Italian Guests Visit Birthplace of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Italian Guests Visit Birthplace of Kim Il Sung
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Osvaldo Napoli, chairman of the Committee for the Development of Relations and Cooperation with the DPRK of the Parliament and vice-president of the Parliamentary Group of the Popular Liberty of the Chamber of Deputies of Italy, and his party, toured Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					At the old home in Mangyongdae, the guests looked round the relics, being briefed on the immortal revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and his patriotic and revolutionary family members there.
					
					They also visited the e-library of Kim Il Sung University and the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace.

articles.title: British Public Figure Visits Pyongyang Mission of AIDNF
articles.content:
British Public Figure Visits Pyongyang Mission of AIDNF
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, on a visit to the DPRK, visited the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-imperialist National Democratic Front on Friday.
					Chief Jo Il Min and staff members of the mission greeted the guest and had a talk with him.
					
					Jo Il Min expressed thanks to the association for issuing a statement against the joint military drills staged by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers against the DPRK recently and extending full support and solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people for peace on the Korean Peninsula and the country's reunification.
					
					He informed the guest of the fact that many organizations for studying and disseminating the Juche idea and Songun politics were formed among south Korean people from all walks of life.
					
					The speech made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the banquet given to celebrate August 25, the anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership, instilled fresh faith and optimism into the south Korean people, he stressed.
					
					Dermot Hudson said that the struggle of the Korean people for the country's reunification is sure to triumph as they are led by Kim Jong Un, faithful successor to the idea and cause of the preceding leaders.
					
					The association will conduct brisk activities to support and encourage the south Korean people in their struggle for independence against the U.S. and for the country's reunification in the future, too, Dermot Hudson added.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, arrived here on Friday to visit the DPRK on the 64th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					Also arriving here were a delegation of Chinese publishers headed by Yan Xiaohong, vice director-general of the General Administration of Press and Publication of China, and Kanji Inoki, president of the Inoki Genom Joint Co., Ltd. of Japan, and his party.
					
					On the same day Wan Yongxiang, former Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and his party, and a delegation of the All-China Journalists Association led by Huang Libiao, president of China Women Newspaper, left here for home.

articles.title: Moon Sun Myung Awarded National Reunification Prize
articles.content:
Moon Sun Myung Awarded National Reunification Prize
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK conferred National Reunification Prize upon Moon Sun Myung, president of the World Peace Federation.
					Moon positively contributed to realizing the nation's reconciliation and unity and the country's peaceful reunification and achieving the prosperity common to the nation, true to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il's idea of the great national unity and line of national reunification.
					
					In this regard a decree was proclaimed by the SPA Presidium on Thursday.

articles.title: Monument to Kim Jong Il's Proposition on Songun Revolutionary Leadership Erected
articles.content:
Monument to Kim Jong Il's Proposition on Songun Revolutionary Leadership Erected
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A monument to Proposition "Chol Pass Is Symbol of Songun Revolutionary Leadership. Kim Jong Il" was erected at the entrance to Chol Pass. 
					Kim Jong Il in jumper all his life emerged victorious in the acute political and military confrontation with imperialists, putting the dignity and prestige of Kim Il Sung's nation on the highest level.
					
					Officials, shock brigaders and working people in Kosan County and other areas of Kangwon Province erected the large monument at the best level with ardent loyalty. 
					
					This is an expression of faith and will of all service personnel and people of the DPRK to glorify the feats he performed before the country and people, the era and history with his original Songun revolutionary leadership and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started in Mt. Paektu under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					An unveiling ceremony took place on the spot on Friday.
					
					Present there were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Paek Kye Ryong, chief secretary of the Kangwon Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Won To Hui, chairperson of the Provincial People's Committee, and officials concerned, service personnel of the Korean People's Army, shock brigaders and working people in Kosan County. 
					
					At the end of the ceremony, the participants were briefed on the proposition.

articles.title: Mosaic Depicting Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Erected in Thongil Street
articles.content:
Mosaic Depicting Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Erected in Thongil Street
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A mosaic depicting President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il "They were always together in the efforts to bring happiness to the people" was erected in Thongil Street here.
					The dear respected Kim Jong Un made sure that the mosaic portraying the peerlessly great men working together to bring happiness to the people was erected in the centre of Thongil Street, in reflection of the ardent wishes of all Pyongyangites.
					
					The mosaic makes an impressive artistic depiction of the immortal revolutionary careers of the President and the leader who made endless journeys for loving care and devotion to the people despite rain or snow to mix with people all their lives.
					
					The erection of the mosaic is a manifestation of the highest tribute of all party members and working people to the peerless great saints.
					
					Its unveiling ceremony took place on Friday.
					
					Present there were Mun Kyong Dok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief secretary of its Pyongyang City Committee, Ryang Man Gil, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, Ri Man Song, chairman of the Pyongyang City Rural Economy Committee, officials concerned and working people in the city.
					
					The participants laid floral baskets before the mosaic in the name of the party, power and economic bodies, working people's organizations, factories, enterprises, farms and universities before paying tribute to the President and the leader.
					
					Mun Kyong Dok made an unveiling speech.
					
					At the end of the ceremony the participants were briefed on the mosaic.

articles.title: Seminar on Works of Kim Jong Il Held at Kim Il Sung University
articles.content:
Seminar on Works of Kim Jong Il Held at Kim Il Sung University
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A seminar on works authored by leader Kim Jong Il during the period of guiding the military camping of students of Kim Il Sung University at Oundong took place at the university on Friday.
					Expounded at the seminar was immortal exploits performed by Kim Jong Il who provided the ideological and theoretical guarantee for accomplishing the cause of Songun revolution by comprehensively developing in depth the Juche-oriented military idea and theory of President Kim Il Sung during the days of guiding the training for military camping in Oundong.
					
					Kim Jong Il in his various works formulated and systematized in an integral way the starting principle and essence of the Juche-based military idea and theory of the President and their historical position and guiding principles, developing in depth them in a new and original way. 
					
					Associate Prof. and Dr. Ryu Un Chul, dean of a faculty of the university, and other speakers said it was thanks to Kim Jong Il's outstanding ideological and theoretical activities that the firm ideological and theoretical foundation for the building of the revolutionary armed forces and military activities have been laid, providing a sure guarantee for victoriously advancing the Songun revolutionary cause, they added.
					
					The works of Kim Jong Il played a big role in helping students firmly arm themselves with the Juche war method and possess versatile and wide military knowledge.
					
					Kim Jong Il comprehensively expounded the idea that the all-people defence system is an invincible and powerful defence system, an undying ideological and theoretical feat by which he provided a sure guarantee for defending and glorifying the President's Songun leadership feats and carrying forward to completion the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					The speakers called for deeply studying and grasping the ideological and theoretical exploits of Kim Jong Il and making positive contributions to demonstrating the honor of victors in the on-going general advance for bringing a heyday of prosperity under the Songun leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: 14th National Exhibition of Scientific and Technological Achievements in Public Health Opens
articles.content:
14th National Exhibition of Scientific and Technological Achievements in Public Health Opens
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The 14th national exhibition of scientific and technological achievements in public health opened with due ceremony in the Hall of New Technology and Innovation of the Three Revolution Exhibition on Friday.
					On display there are more than 2 400 products, diagrams, multi-media, etc. introducing medical science and technology achievements made by scientists, technicians and medical workers of healthcare institutions and enterprises at various levels from across the country. 
					
					The exhibition will also involve a scientific and technological forum, exchange and service for intellectual products and various other activities to introduce the method of diagnosis and treatment of significance in clinical practice and the achievements made in inventing new medical appliances and medicines.
					
					Present at the ceremony were officials, scientists and technicians in the field of public health in Pyongyang and local areas. 
					
					The inaugural speech was made at the opening ceremony.
					
					At the end of the ceremony the participants looked round the exhibition. 
					
					It will last till next Thursday.

articles.title: Dancing Party of Women's Union Members Held
articles.content:
Dancing Party of Women's Union Members Held
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A dancing party of women's union members took place at the plaza of the Arch of Triumph on Friday on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the foundation of the DPRK.
					At the dancing party which began with the playing of "Song of the Proclamation of the People's Republic" the participants danced to the tune of songs "Our General Is the Best" and "Fly Our Tri-color National Flag of the Republic" in boundless reverence for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The playing of such songs as "Song of Woman" and "My Wife" added to the pride of women respected as flowers of the era and revolutionaries under the care of the peerlessly great persons, making the dancing party more cheerful.
					
					They also danced to the tune of songs "Let Us Meet at the Front" and "We Visit You before Any Others", fully reflecting the women in Songun era who are leading a worthwhile life, carving out a rosy future with love and devotion.

articles.title: Nano-fiber Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Nano-fiber Developed in DPRK
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The 12th national exhibition of inventions and new technologies was held in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea some days ago.
					Among the exhibits was antibiotic nano-fiber, developed by Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					
					The fiber is suitable to making such sterilized products as white gown, surgical robe and gloves.
					
					Applied in foodstuff factories and health services, it was found to have high antibiosis, with no adverse effect on human body.
					
					The fiber, woven by the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill, has been put into use at the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory and the Pyongyang Beer Factory.

articles.title: Ullim Falls
articles.content:
Ullim Falls
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Ullim Falls is one of the tourist destinations in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					The 75-meter-high falls is located in deep mountains in Chonnae County, Kangwon Province.
					
					It is breathtaking to see it cascading from a precipitous cliff.
					
					The falls hit a rock in the halfway and divides into twin falls at the height of 45 meters, making thunderous sound echo as far as four kilometers around.
					
					Surrounded by a slew of peaks, it is redolent of unrolling of white silk clothes in distant sight.
					
					The falls is originated from ranges of Masik Pass, with 20 to 25 cubic meters of water volume per second.
					
					At the bottom of the falls, there is a pond, 1.5 meters deep and 30 meters in radius, inhabited with minnow, rainbow trout and other species of fishes.
					
					A sightseeing path, spillway, meal site and car park were built in the area of the falls.
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il in his lifetime suggested turning the falls into a tourist destination.

articles.title: Army and People Launch Campaign to Recover from Damage in Komdok Area of DPRK
articles.content:
Army and People Launch Campaign to Recover from Damage in Komdok Area of DPRK
						
Tanchon, September 7 (KCNA) -- Intensive drive is being waged in the mine areas of Komdok, Ryongyang and Taehung of the DPRK to recover from damage.
					Units of the Korean People's Army rushed to the afflicted areas on the order of Supreme Commander Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Primary efforts are being paid to relinking the severed railways and roads and bringing the life of the stricken inhabitants to normal.
					
					According to initial data, this area suffered from huge damage.
					
					More than 2,000 houses were leveled and 170 odd public buildings destroyed or drifted away, claiming casualties.
					
					Two pits were totally inundated at the Ryongyang Mine and production stopped. A branch factory disappeared at the Taehung Youth Hero Mine and only skeletons of several light burning kilns are left. Pits were inundated or collapsed at the Komdok Mining Complex.
					
					At least 1 800 pieces of equipment including excavators and large blowers and pipes were washed away, buried or destroyed at these mines.
					
					Communication networks were cut off. Power lines were also cut off or washed away, impeding the supply of power for industrial use, drinking water and lighting.
					
					More than 1.32 million cubic meters of roads disappeared or were destroyed in more than 870 sections and railway beds, iron bridges and rails were inundated or buried and many bridges drifted away.
					
					It has become impossible to expect harvest in at least 700 hectares of farmland in Tanchon City.
					
					Service personnel and people have turned out in the drive to recover from damage.
					
					Officials of ministries and national institutions and other units and working people across the country are rendering sincere help.

articles.title: Korean Book and Photo Exhibition Held in China
articles.content:
Korean Book and Photo Exhibition Held in China
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A Korean book and photo exhibition was held in Daqing City, Heilongjiang Province, China on August 30 on the occasions of the first anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's visit to the Northeastern region of China and the 52nd anniversary of his start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					Displayed in the venue were photos of his visit to the Northeastern Region of China, his feats performed in the Songun revolutionary leadership and his revolutionary career.
					
					Also on display there were works of the peerlessly great men and books and photos showing the achievements made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation.
					
					Present at the opening ceremony were officials and masses of the city, staff members of the DPRK consulate general in Shenyang and Korean officials working in Daqing City.
					
					Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					The deputy mayor of the city said that it is in the common interests of the two parties and two peoples to carry forward and develop generation after generation the traditional Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations provided by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries.
					
					We will together with Korean comrades boost the Sino-DPRK friendly relations in the spirit of inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation, the deputy mayor added.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Decries S. Korea's Rhetoric against DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Decries S. Korea's Rhetoric against DPRK
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The rat-like Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea is resorting to the sordid propaganda after it was put to shame in the world eyes in the face of the DPRK's just declaration of a great war for national reunification and its strong spirit to make merciless retaliation.
					The south Korean authorities let loose such rubbish as "sign of policy change" and "attempt at reform and opening" in the DPRK. They even put to use hack papers and human scum to spread misinformation about the DPRK.
					
					They reported about the "group fleeing" of the DPRK workers and students from China and the Eastern Europe and peddled the story of "use of beautiful women", false stories aimed to defame the DPRK.
					
					They have resorted to their hackneyed method as before.
					
					No-cut News and New Focus posted on Internet the misinformation cooked up by Chongwadae, talking about field source and "testimonies made by defectors from the north". Chosun Ilbo, Choongang Ilbo, Economic Daily and other hack papers echoed it, trying to give impression that it is the international view.
					
					It is a trite method employed by plot-breeding organizations to build up public opinion by releasing false stories by citing plausible sources. This can be easily viewed as a renewed campaign orchestrated by Lee regime to "disrupt the DPRK" and bring about a "regime change".
					
					Clear is a motive for the campaign of fabricating false stories and publicizing them. 
					
					This, indicative of the fear of the mounting international prestige and might of Songun, is just last-ditch efforts of human scum keen on prolonging their remaining days through confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					No matter how desperately the group of rats may do mischief, being unaware of how the world goes about, it can never stem the great advance of the DPRK nor can it cover up the shining truth in it.
					
					It is quite natural for No-Cut News and New Focus which act as first-line shock brigade of the puppet regime to be snubbed and jeered by the world media for their sordid act.
					
					Pitiful and wretched are Lee who stakes his fate on those mental patients and rat-like imbeciles who are just parasites on the stinky living dead Lee.

articles.title: Improvement of Inter-Korean Relations Is Impossible Unless Lee Group Is Ousted: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Improvement of Inter-Korean Relations Is Impossible Unless Lee Group Is Ousted: Rodong Sinmun
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime in south Korea is wholly to blame for the worst phase of the inter-Korean relations and a touch-and-go situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article.
					
					It is a final conclusion that it is impossible to improve the north-south relations and achieve durable peace of the country unless the Lee regime is ousted, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					The regime formulated the watchwords "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars", a criminal theory of confrontation with fellow countrymen, as the conservative authorities' "policy toward the north" in a bid to realize its ambition for invading the DPRK in collusion with foreign forces.
					
					It suspended all dialogues and cooperation which had been under way in the days of the preceding regimes and made the outbreak of a war against the DPRK an established fact, advocating the theory of "the principal enemy" and "preemptive attack." It has staged saber-rattling almost every day.
					
					Pursuant to its conspiratorial scenarios, the Lee regime fabricated the "Cheonan" warship sinking case and the dangerous Yonphyong Island shelling incident in 2010.
					
					Recently, the Lee regime's hideous provocation intended to dare hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK led to politically-motivated terrorism unprecedented in history and madcap nuclear test war drills against the DPRK were staged across south Korea. This indicates that the regime does not hesitate to perpetrate political and military provocations in a bid to do harm to fellow countrymen.
					
					It is the ulterior intention of the Lee regime to realize its wild ambition for invading the DPRK by reducing all parts of Korea to ashes and making them drenched with blood.
					
					It is the unshakable resolution and will of the DPRK not to pardon any force pursuing the policy of confrontation with compatriots and seeking a war against the DPRK in denial of the inter-Korean declarations. The destiny of the nation can never be a plaything of philistines, concludes the article.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Regime's "Human Rights" Campaign against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Regime's "Human Rights" Campaign against DPRK
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The south Korean regime set September as what it called "month of human rights of the north" and is busy kicking up a madcap human rights campaign against the DPRK with all sorts of plot-breeding organizations and human scum involved.
					It is mulling staging a noisy anti-DPRK "human rights" racket with an International Pen Conference to be held in south Korea in mid- September as a momentum.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined commentary terms this another vicious politically-motivated provocation as it will be orchestrated by those hell-bent on north-south confrontation and moves for a war against the DPRK.
					
					The commentary says:
					
					The words "human rights" sound absolutely nonsensical in the DPRK where the dignity and independent rights of the working masses are fully guaranteed legally and institutionally.
					
					The group of conservatives' trumpeting about "north's human rights issue" and the like only reveals its sinister plot to tarnish the image of the socialist system in the DPRK centered on the popular masses and realize its wild dream of "achieving the unification of the social systems" at any cost.
					
					The group of traitors is now working hard to prolong its remaining days, after being branded by the public as the worst hordes of gangsters in power for having mercilessly killed people through fascist dictatorship. It is the height of folly for this group to talk about "human rights" of someone.
					
					The Korean nation can never achieve peace and stability as long as the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is allowed to be at large.
					
					All service personnel and people of the DPRK fully ready for a final battle will surely bring the most shameful destruction to those provocateurs and ill-speakers, warns the commentary.

articles.title: Young People Called upon to Heighten Vigilance against Imperialists' Ideological and Cultural Poisoning
articles.content:
Young People Called upon to Heighten Vigilance against Imperialists' Ideological and Cultural Poisoning
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Progressive countries of the world should heighten vigilance against the imperialists' reactionary ideological and cultural poisoning and psychological warfare against their young people. Rodong Sinmun Friday urges this in a bylined article.
					It says:
					
					The reactionary ideological and cultural poisoning and psychological warfare are means for aggression and interference and a vicious destabilizing method.
					
					The imperialists are intensifying the poisoning operation by using all channels under the pretext of "cooperation" and "exchange", asserting that reactionary ideology and culture can be as effective as military capability in realizing their hegemonic ambition.
					
					A new characteristic feature in the imperialists' destabilizing strategy, reactionary ideological and cultural poisoning and psychological warfare is that they mainly target young people unlike the past when it was focused on the mental degeneration of ordinary people.
					
					Cites facts to prove it, the article goes on:
					
					Imperialists run the whole gamut of intrigues to benumb youngsters, taking advantage of their mental characteristics. It is by no means fortuitous that they craftily take into consideration the fact that not a few young people are more interested in pop music and amusement than politics, drastically increase the number of amusement programs in broadcasting for young people and include between them programs propagandizing "advantages" of capitalist system, etc.
					
					Because, it is their view that young people played not a small role in bringing about "Egyptian-style change" and "Libyan-style victory" in some countries.
					
					The imperialists calculate that they can achieve their purpose more easily by luring youngsters and intensifying the reactionary ideological and cultural poisoning and psychological warfare against them.
					
					One may say young people stand at the crossroads: whether they will become useful for revolution and society or get degenerate.
					
					The article underscores the need to conduct effective education for preparing young people as able pillars for revolution and construction.

articles.title: Measures against Sexual Abuses Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Measures against Sexual Abuses Urged in S. Korea
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Women organizations in south Korea held a press conference outside the building of the Kwangju City Office on September 4 urging the authorities to take measures against sexual assaults against women. Those organizations included the federation of women's organizations in Kwangju of South Jolla Province, the Kwangju council of women's organizations, the Kwangju council of civic organizations and the Kwangju society of human rights.
					At the conference the speakers deplored that sexual abuses against juveniles and women are on the steady increase.
					
					Recalling that sexual abuses against even pregnant women broke out in the wake of sexual assaults and murder of a girl of a primary school, a woman on Jeju Island and a housewife, they declared that these cases are attributable to the irresponsibility on the part of the "government."
					
					It should not just take a stopgap measure against the occurrence of each case but take positive steps against such crimes, they urged.
					
					In the meantime, a women's organization in Kwangju region declared it would stage a candlelight rally every Tuesday from that day in demand of measures against sexual abuses against women.

articles.title: Serious Sexual Abuses in S. Korea
articles.content:
Serious Sexual Abuses in S. Korea
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Sexual assaults have increased in south Korea, becoming a serious social problem.
					The cases of sexual abuses including rape amounted to more than 81 800 cases from 2007 to 2011 at least 9 180 cases of which remain unsettled, according to the puppet Police Agency on Sept. 5.
					
					Rampant are sexual abuses against minors including children, in particular, sparking off public criticism.
					
					The daily increasing cases of more cruel sexual assaults are throwing the south Korean society into uneasiness and horror.

articles.title: Members of Opposition Party Denounce Prosecution for Its Crackdown
articles.content:
Members of Opposition Party Denounce Prosecution for Its Crackdown
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Members of Kwangju City Committee of the Unified Progressive Party of South Korea held a press conference in Kwangju on Sept. 3 in denunciation of prosecution's base crackdown.  
					At the press conference, the speakers accused the Kwangju District Prosecutor's Office of sending the list of members of the Unified Progressive Party to more than 40 offices in Kwangju and South Jolla Province and asking for information about their tendencies during the last "National Assembly" election. 
					
					They branded this as an infringement upon the freedom of political activities and human rights and an action to disturb the just trade union activities of members of the opposition party.
					
					Assailing the prosecution for suppressing the political activities of the opposition party not only in Kwangju but in various other regions of south Korea, they said that all investigations are directed to derailing the solidarity in the opposition camp in the "presidential" election.
					
					The speakers demanded the prosecution stop at once the unreasonable crackdown upon the opposition party being perpetrated in a bid to make the "Saenuri Party" stay in power.

articles.title: Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Visits Birthplace of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Visits Birthplace of Kim Il Sung
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan headed by Ko Tok U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, toured Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. The group is visiting the homeland to take part in the celebrations of the 64th anniversary of the foundation of the DPRK.
					The members of the group laid bouquets before the graves of Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik, grandparents of Kim Il Sung, and those of Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok, his parents, and observed a moment's silence.
					
					They looked round relics in the old home in Mangyongdae, recollecting with deep emotion the immortal revolutionary career of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung.
					
					The head of the delegation said that the visit to Mangyongdae made his yearning for Kim Il Sung stronger.
					
					The President built the socialist power on this land, the head said, praising him as the pioneer of the revolutionary cause of Juche and father of socialist Korea.
					
					The group also visited the state industrial fine art exhibition.

articles.title: Chongryon Lecture Marks Birthday of DPRK
articles.content:
Chongryon Lecture Marks Birthday of DPRK
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A lecture of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) was given at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Thursday to celebrate the 64th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					Present there were vice chairmen of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, advisors to it, its directors, leading officials of central institutions and  enterprises of Chongryon, chairmen of Chongryon Headquarters in Kanto area and other officials and compatriots.
					
					They watched the Korean film dealing with the fact that Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un significantly celebrated August 25, the anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership, with service personnel when he was inspecting the eastern sector of the front and video lecture "Our homeland advancing toward final victory full of faith".

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Carried by Nepalese and Indonesian Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Carried by Nepalese and Indonesian Papers
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese newspaper Nepal Today on August 31 carried the gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People".
					The work, made public on April 20, 2012 clarifies the revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in their lifetimes. It also indicates the tasks for firmly upholding and eternally glorifying their ideas and feats.
					
					The Indonesian paper Suara Karya on September 3 carried a detailed gist of his work "Let Us Effect Kim Jong Il's Patriotism and Step Up the Building of a Prosperous Country."
					
					The work, published on July 26, 2012, clarifies the essence of Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his life characterized by his love for the country and people.
					
					It also clarifies important issues arising in embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Internet Website of Brazilian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Internet Website of Brazilian Organization
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its Internet website bulletin No. 1 a detailed content of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Only Victory and Glory Are in Store for Us Advancing under the Uplifted Immortal Banners Bearing Portraits of the Smiling Great Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il".
					Kim Jong Un clarified great Generalissimo Kim Jong Il's Songun exploits at the banquet given to celebrate August 25, 2012.
					
					He stressed the need to vigorously struggle for the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun pioneered and led to victory by Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Leadership Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Leadership Marked Abroad
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					Seminars were held in Nigeria and Pakistan, a lecture in Austria, a ceremony for opening a Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition in Mexico, photo exhibition in Malaysia and a book and photo exhibition at the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement between Aug. 24 and 29.
					
					Displayed in the venues of the events were photos showing the Songun leadership exploits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					On display there were works of the peerlessly great men, photos showing the true appearance of Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with the creative talents of the Korean people.
					
					The chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said that Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership ushered in a new era of prosperity unprecedented in the Korean nation's history spanning 5 000 years.
					
					The chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy said it is inevitability of history brought by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, pioneers and leaders of Songun revolution, that the Korean people demonstrated their might as an independent people whom nobody dares provoke.
					
					The chief of the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, Austria noted that it is entirely attributable to the Songun politics, matchless army and all people single-mindedly united around their leader that the U.S. dares not provoke the DPRK.
					
					The general secretary of the C.C., the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, in a speech said that the Songun revolutionary cause of Juche is sure to win victory as long as there is Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK.
					
					A message to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar in Pakistan.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Il Sung in Nation-Building Introduced by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Il Sung in Nation-Building Introduced by Foreign Papers
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries introduced the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung in the nation-building.
					The September issue of the Russian newspaper Serp I Molot carried an article titled "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea was founded on September 9, 1948."
					
					Referring to the foundation of the DPRK by Kim Il Sung, the article said:
					
					He was the nation's benefactor who liberated Korea from the yoke of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					He was the great general who defeated the U.S. and its satellite forces in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					The paper introduced the DPRK which was turned into a socialist state centered on the popular masses under the leadership of the peerlessly great persons.
					
					The Nepalese newspaper Ostito on Aug. 31 said that Kim Il Sung liberated the country through a hard-fought revolutionary struggle and built a prosperous country and leader Kim Jong Il devoted all his efforts to turn the DPRK into a thriving nation, adding the ideas and cause of the preceding leaders have been successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un at present.
					
					The September 1st issue of the Bangladeshi paper Ekota in an article titled the "Exploits of President Kim Il Sung in the nation-building" said that his feats in nation-building will shine forever.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversary Marked by Bangladeshi Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversary Marked by Bangladeshi Organizations
						
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi organizations issued bulletins on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the foundation of the DPRK.
					The Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee carried an article in its bulletin "Strength of DPRK" on August 29. The article said:
					
					The DPRK is not a big country in its territory and population but has tremendous strength which no one dares match.
					
					The traditional single-minded unity of the Korean society was provided by President Kim Il Sung, the father of socialist Korea, and consolidated by leader Kim Jong Il. It has been put on a higher level by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					The Songun cause which was pioneered by Kim Il Sung and developed in depth by Kim Jong Il is being given steady continuity by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					Only victory is always in store for the Korean people advancing under his leadership.
					
					The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea carried an article in its bulletin "21st century and the Juche idea" on August 27. 
					
					The article noted:
					
					The Juche idea is a banner for dynamically leading the trend in the 21st century to the road of independence against imperialism.
					
					Kim Il Sung, founder of the Juche idea, in his several works unrolled a plan for global independence. The Juche idea will shine long along with the stirring 21st century.

articles.title: MINREX publica declaracion sobre la ocupacion del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe felicitacion de cuerpos extranjeros en Corea
						
Pyongyang, 7 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un recibio cestos de flores y cartas de felicitacion que le dirigieran el Cuerpo Diplomatico y el de Agregados Militares acreditados en Corea con motivo del 64o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					El embajador camboyano Chhorn Hay y el chino Liu Hongcai trasladaron el dia 7 el cesto de flores y las cartas de felicitacion al canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun en representacion del cuerpo diplomatico.
					
					En el caso del segundo cuerpo, lo hizo el agregado militar irani Hassan Reza Husseini, quien encabeza el cuerpo, al vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Kim Jong Gak, quien es ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares. 
					
					Por otra parte, fueron entregados a los funcionarios correspondientes cestos de flores y cartas de felicitacion dirigidos al Mariscal por el embajador camboyano y el director de la Oficina de Cooperacion Economica de Libia, en Corea, y el cesto de flores del embajador nigeriano en Corea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral a feretro de difunto Moon Sun Myung
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral a feretro de difunto Moon Sun Myung
						
Pyongyang, 7 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio el dia 7 ante el feretro del difunto Moon Sun Myung, presidente de la Federacion Mundial de la Paz, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje del presidente sirio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje del presidente sirio
						
Pyongyang, 7 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el dia 5 el Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad.
					La misiva sigue:
					
					Con motivo del 64o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, extiendo las mas sinceras felicitaciones a Vd. y su pueblo amistoso en nombre del pueblo sirio y en el mio propio y deseo a Vd. buena salud y a su pueblo, mayor progreso y prosperidad.
					
					Aprovecho esta oportunidad para afirmar que fortalecere  las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la Republica Arabe de Siria y la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea conforme al bienestar de los dos pueblos amistosos.
					
					Reciba el testimonio de mi mas alta consideracion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje del presidente libanes
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje del presidente libanes
						
Pyongyang, 7 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el dia 3 el presidente de la Republica de Libano, Michel Souleyman.
					La misiva senala:
					
					Con motivo del dia de fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, me alegro de extenderle de todo corazon mi felicitacion a Vd. en nombre del pueblo libanes y en el mio propio y deseo a Vd. la felicidad y exitos y al pueblo coreano la prosperidad.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe felicitacion de cuerpos extranjeros en Corea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe felicitacion de cuerpos extranjeros en Corea
						
Pyongyang, 7 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un recibio cestos de flores y cartas de felicitacion que le dirigieran el Cuerpo Diplomatico y el de Agregados Militares acreditados en Corea con motivo del 64o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					El embajador camboyano Chhorn Hay y el chino Liu Hongcai trasladaron el dia 7 el cesto de flores y las cartas de felicitacion al canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun en representacion del cuerpo diplomatico.
					
					En el caso del segundo cuerpo, lo hizo el agregado militar irani Hassan Reza Husseini, quien encabeza el cuerpo, al vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Kim Jong Gak, quien es ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares. 
					
					Por otra parte, fueron entregados a los funcionarios correspondientes cestos de flores y cartas de felicitacion dirigidos al Mariscal por el embajador camboyano y el director de la Oficina de Cooperacion Economica de Libia, en Corea, y el cesto de flores del embajador nigeriano en Corea.

articles.title: Conversan delegaciones coreana y vietnamita en Pyongyang
articles.content:
Conversan delegaciones coreana y vietnamita en Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 7 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar este viernes en esta capital las conversaciones entre la delegacion del Comite Central del Frente Democratico para la Reunificacion de la Patria y la del CC del Frente de la Patria de Vietnam.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion del CC del FDRP encabezada por el director del secretariado Kim Wan Su, y por la vietnamita, los miembros de la delegacion vietnamita presidida por el presidente Huing Dam y el embajador vietnamita en Corea, Le Quang Ba.
					
					Ambas partes intercambiaron los criterios sobre los asuntos de interes mutuo, tales como el de desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambas entidades.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC en Sur de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 7 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Las autoridades surcoreanas fijaron el mes de septiembre como "mes para los derechos humanos del Norte (de Corea)" y libran una febril campana anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea movilizando varias entidades intrigantes y escorias humanas.
					Ademas pretenden recrudecer esa campana aprovechando la Conferencia Internacional de Pluma que tendra lugar a mediados de este mes en el Sur de Corea.
					
					En un comentario individual difundido este viernes, el periodico Rodong Sinmun lo califico de brutal provocacion politica de los maniacos de confrontacion intercoreana y guerra de agresion al Norte, y prosiguio:
					
					El problema de "DDHH" no hay ni habra en la RPDC donde la dignidad y los derechos independientes de las masas trabajadoras estan garantizados legal e institucionalmente.
					
					Los "DDHH del Norte", de que habla tanto la banda conservadora surcoreana, devienen una expresion del malsano intento de difamar el regimen socialista al estilo coreano centrado en las masas populares y realizar cueste lo que cueste su ilusion de la "unificacion mediante la fusion de regimenes".
					
					Esa camarilla de gangsteres llego al poder por medio de la represion fascista y sangrienta a las masas populares y esta ahora en agonia politica siendo repudiada por el pueblo. Sin embargo, esta cuestionando ridiculamente el problema de "DDHH" de la RPDC.
					
					Mientras exista la horda traidora de Lee Myung Bak, la nacion coreana no lograra nunca la paz ni la estabilidad.
					
					Todo el ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC, que entraron en la disposicion de combate final, daran el arruinamiento mas vergonzoso a los provocadores y chismosos de peor calana.
